user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap:
```c
static void metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap(struct linux_bus *lbus,
				    struct linux_device *ldev,
				    uint32_t dir,
				    struct metal_sg *sg,
				    int nents)
{
	(void) lbus;
	(void) ldev;
	(void) dir;
	(void) sg;
	(void) nents;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
(void) dir;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The statement “(void) dir;” is an expression-statement used to mark the parameter as used (to suppress unused-parameter diagnostics). It is located in the body of the function and will be executed when the function is called, so it is not unreachable. (Even though a compiler may optimize away the generated code, that optimization does not make the source statement unreachable.)
